text: hi there my name is Robin Hill and I
look after our retail and cpg customers
in Asia Pacific here at AWS I've
recently been in New York and I wanted
to share three observations I had from
the stores in New York which I find
quite different and a little evolving
verus what I've experien previously the
first one is the absolute passion of
team members in the retail here in New
York and particularly store managers or
even assistant store managers those that
we spoke to were so filled with the joy
of explaining the history of the
business they work for many had actually
gone and opened various Flagship stores
across countries uh to make sure that
they represented their brand
appropriately and I really think there's
something also with one of the stores
where they kit out all their team
members to have the apparel that they
sell and then they link to their message
of going out every quarter and having
team activities out and Outdoors to
fulfill their Brand's Mission so that
the team members from all levels across
the store have a really great
understanding of how does this apparel
actually work in the environment that
it's designed for so I think that's
pretty cool the second um is around
scarcity there was a few examples of
both a perfumery but also a really um
sophisticated grocery store I went to
that both had aspects of limited
editions and for the grocery store
really small limited editions so only 20
to 30 jars of of some certain type of
honey and from the perfumery um having
different depths of sophistication uh
and strengths of perfume in this one
store that's the only place that you can
get this brand uh globally so lots of um
push there on the social media um
because you know scarcity breeds
interest and the final one is around
personalization what I'm talking about
here is folks having a personalized
experience in store not just from having
um Blaze their name on an item that you
purchase in the store which of course is
a really interesting use case as well
but more so around personalized health
care and wellness folks engaging stores
for l
knowledge effectively when it comes to
health and wellness um and looking for
an alternative to our traditional big
farmer approaches to solving health and
medical conditions which I thought was
really interesting here again the trust
and the the way that the the store teams
help folks navigate a personalized
outcome and a personalized purchase um
was phenomenal to witness so those are
the three quick Trends I saw in New York
hope you found them interesting and I'm
happy to chat further on them thanks for
your time
